title: Run test suite and verify all tests pass
Test production build process
Evaluate hosting options for cost-effective self-funded deployment
description:
## Context
Project was previously hosted on Qovery and AWS. Need to find a new hosting solution.

## Requirements
- Must support Express + Socket.io (real-time WebSocket connections)
- Redis for game state
- MongoDB for inventory (currently using Atlas)
- Goal: Self-funded via ads or similar, so minimizing ongoing costs is critical

## Options to evaluate
- **Railway** - Easy Node.js deploys, built-in Redis, good DX
- **Render** - Free tier available, managed services
- **Fly.io** - Global edge, good for low-latency
- **Split architecture** - Netlify/Vercel for frontend, separate backend host

## Considerations
- Free tiers and their limitations
- Cost scaling as usage grows
- WebSocket support quality
- Redis/MongoDB managed service costs vs self-hosted
- Ease of deployment and maintenance

title: Evaluate migrating from AVA to Vitest
description: After Vite migration is complete, evaluate whether to migrate tests from AVA to Vitest. Vitest benefits: (1) Native Vite integration with shared config, (2) Faster test execution, (3) Better TypeScript/ESM support, (4) Jest-compatible API, (5) Built-in coverage with c8, (6) Watch mode with HMR. Evaluation criteria: (1) Migration effort vs benefits, (2) AVA compatibility with Vite setup, (3) Test performance comparison, (4) Developer experience. Decision: migrate to Vitest, keep AVA, or keep both (unit tests in Vitest, integration in AVA). Document findings and recommendation.

Testing plan: (1) Update one at a time, (2) Test all HTTP endpoints (/ping, /name, /avatar, pack purchase), (3) Verify MongoDB pack inventory queries, (4) Verify Redis pub/sub and streams for game tables, (5) Test full gameplay flow (War, Browse, Solitaire). description: The production build currently requires NODE_OPTIONS=--openssl-legacy-provider to work with Node.js 17+. Consider one of these solutions: (1) Upgrade react-scripts from 4.0.3 to version 5.x (which supports Node.js 17+), (2) Add the NODE_OPTIONS flag to package.json build script, (3) Document the workaround in SETUP.md and CLAUDE.md, (4) Consider downgrading to Node.js 16 LTS if stability is more important. Stage 3 (major breaking changes - test each): Express 4→5 (breaking changes), MongoDB 4→7 (API changes), Redis 4→5, Taquito 12→24 (verify blockchain integration still works), React 18→19 (evaluate - may want to stay on 18.x). title: Add standalone typecheck script for fast feedback
description: Add npm script for TypeScript type-checking without running tests or building. Benefits: (1) Fast feedback loop during development, (2) Can be used in CI before tests, (3) Catches type errors without waiting for full build. Implementation: Add script 'typecheck': 'tsc --noEmit' to package.json. Also add 'typecheck:watch': 'tsc --noEmit --watch' for continuous checking during development. This should work for both server (src/*.ts) and client code. Verify it catches type errors correctly.

title: Configure ESLint + Prettier for TypeScript and React
description: Set up proper linting and formatting for consistent code style. Currently only has basic react-app ESLint config, no Prettier. Steps: (1) Install eslint-config-prettier, @typescript-eslint/parser, @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin, prettier, (2) Create .eslintrc.json with TypeScript + React rules, (3) Create .prettierrc with project style (suggest: 2 spaces, single quotes, trailing commas), (4) Add .prettierignore for build/, node_modules/, etc., (5) Add scripts: 'lint': 'eslint src --ext .ts,.tsx', 'format': 'prettier --write src', 'format:check': 'prettier --check src'. This is foundational for pre-commit hooks and CI.

title: Migrate from Create React App to Vite
description: Migrate the React build system from react-scripts (CRA/webpack) to Vite for significant DX improvements: (1) Instant HMR vs slow webpack reloads, (2) Faster builds using esbuild, (3) Smaller bundle sizes, (4) No Node.js 17+ compatibility issues, (5) Modern ESM-first tooling. Migration steps: Update package.json to replace react-scripts with vite + @vitejs/plugin-react, create vite.config.ts with proper configuration for Unity WebGL assets, update index.html to be in root with module script tags, update npm scripts (dev/build/preview), test Socket.io client connections still work, verify Unity WebGL integration, ensure environment variables work (import.meta.env vs process.env). This resolves the Node.js 17+ issue and provides better developer experience for all future work.

description: Set up Git pre-commit hooks for fast feedback on code quality. Requires ESLint + Prettier to be configured first. Steps: (1) Install husky and lint-staged, (2) Run 'npx husky install' and add to npm prepare script, (3) Create .husky/pre-commit hook, (4) Configure lint-staged in package.json to run on staged files only: '*.{ts,tsx}': ['eslint --fix', 'prettier --write', 'tsc --noEmit']. title: Add local development state reset script
description: Create script to quickly reset local Redis and MongoDB state during development. Useful when testing fresh game sessions or debugging. Implementation: Create scripts/reset-dev-state.sh that: (1) Flushes all Redis keys (redis-cli FLUSHALL), (2) Optionally clears MongoDB test collections (if using local MongoDB), (3) Preserves production data (check NODE_ENV), (4) Confirms before destructive operations. Add npm script 'dev:reset': './scripts/reset-dev-state.sh'. Safety: Must only work in development mode, refuse to run if NODE_ENV=production. Document in README for onboarding new developers.

title: Add c8 coverage thresholds to prevent regressions
description: Configure c8 coverage thresholds to ensure code quality doesn't regress. Currently c8 is used but no thresholds are enforced (current coverage: 36.13%). Implementation: Add to package.json c8 config: check-coverage: true, lines: 40 (start conservative, above current 36%), branches: 30, functions: 40, statements: 40. Add --check-coverage flag to npm test script. CI will fail if coverage drops below thresholds. Can gradually increase thresholds as coverage improves. This prevents shipping untested code.

description: Create single command to bootstrap development environment for new developers or AI agents. Useful for /parallel-work sessions or onboarding.
